comments.commentBody:
This overly dramatic soap opera of "will she or won't she run for president" which no one doubts and is just used to keep her name in the press...is a ploy as old as it is tiresome to any intelligent voter. Hillary could not stay no more stay away from accumulating more power than a moth could stay away from a flame.

We need new and invigorating thinking to put our Republic back on track not the same old leadership dressed up this time in pearl and a pants suit

I think Condi Rice could give her a run for her money. Rice would fire up the Republican Party and address their gender and race issues in a two for one. Rice would also garner many Indepedent votes, because she is seen as fiscally conservative but sympathetic to cultural issues. Women of color would support her with their votes, because she represents a type of feminism that is inclusive (something many white feminists do not represent and sadly don't understand that they don't).
She couldn't get out of the Republican primary gate.

Hillary will definitely run, I believe. She just isn't ready for the full campaign mode that takes over every minute of the candidate's life. She will announce when the time is right and she definitely has my vote.
It is true that she is less liberal than I would like, but I think she is by far the best possible candidate in either party.
I feel sorry for whatever Republican will run against her. She is a champion.

In view of the lack of support for this Presidency, I also expect African American voter turnout will drop drastically for the 2016 election, along with  American voters of all nationalities, genders and cultural backgrounds.  Not that it matters, but this Irish French American is never voting again.

Took the words right out of my mouth, Bill.  Hillary's got her faults, but being a first degree relative of a former president has never been a "rule out", and those who think it is have to ask themselves if they feel that way about JQAdams, GWBush, Jeb Bush, etc. etc. Perhaps ten years ago one might have questioned Hillary's qualifications, but at this point she has more relevant experience than many current (male) members of congress whose qualifications no-one would question if they chose to run tomorrow.

As a native New Yorker it galled me when she ran for the Senate. Where are the feminists? She would never have been elected to a city council if she wasn't Mrs Bill Clinton. She has leveraged his position for her own advancement. The limo and house in Arkansas, the White House SS protection when running in New York and the grabbing onto the 1% that she always wanted to be a part of. A Bella Abzug she ain't.

Philipp Roseman thinks Hillary should be automatically ruled out because of Bill. Thinking simply, and that kind of judgment is simple enough, would have kept FDR out because of Teddy. Cousins and all that. It would have ruled out Bobby Kennedy and Teddy, the latter sponsor of more successful legislation measures than any senator in 100 years.
I have a less simple but pretty simple alternative: Let's examine Hill's credentials, her hopes, and her allegiances, and then decide whether we need her. It's fair, it's open-minded, it's the American way.

This country should not be governed by a few wealthy and influential families, whether they are called Bush, Cuomo, Kennedy, or Clinton. The very fact that Mrs. Clinton is the wife of President Bill Clinton should rule her out as a candidate for the presidency.
What is surprising about that?
I think she's 68.

It has been more than 31 months since Mrs. Clinton announced her desire to step off "the high wire of American politics" after a combined 20 years as first lady, senator, presidential candidate and secretary of state, yet she has been coyly but unconvincingly doing the Dance of the Seven Veils about 2016 ever since. At nearly 67 and with a pace like that, it's good to know that she has a workout regimen, but it's surprising that with the yoga, there's no Zumba.

there never will be a 'correct' value of the euro and the dollar .
There might be a value - where some economists believe it gives the US an advantage - and another value - where some others complain - that it is to Europes advantage - or 'them Germans' are now building their 'colony' with it.

And this - like the Maastricht in a Kilt discussion - will just prove how awesome dataistic economix truly are...
I suspect a non white male Vice President candidate who is closer to 40 will help with some demographics.
In 50 years when Republicans might nominate a woman.

Sorry but pictures can lie.
We all know the Liberal press will only release " good " pictures of Hillary.

I would rather look at Niki Halley for 4 -8 years
Time to rest? I think they call that Botox.

She looks ten years younger now that she had some time to rest.  But seriously, please do not assume that NYT readers are interested in this type of personal  coverage of a woman that might run for the Oval Service.
I say it was was a business arrangement that insured more photo ops for both of them.  Nasty I know, but then I am a cynic, not a romantic.
27 times under Shortz and 29 times pre-Shorts and this is the only time for the clue out of all those times.

John, I gather you've uncovered a rare photo of a fairly young JK, if I'm not mistaken?
The Owl Glasses he always wore hopefully led me to his ID?

Howie
One each Shortz and pre for KERNS with this sense.  The Maleska was "Tails of Q's."  Ah, the good old days.

Martin, BIKER CHICK?

Deb, you cracked me up. I was thinking the same thing.

Following a trial is not the same as being at the trial, so I can't say that I know better than the judge. The intruder explanation does not make sense to me. But I didn't hear Pistorius and others testify.
Except that the bathroom window was proven to be both too high off the ground and too small for anyone to have crawled through.
Are you suggesting he had a testosterone imbalance? Every man has testosterone, few of us are overwhelmed by it to the point of killing.

You think I'm not a taxpayer?? Where did you get that idea? I worked just as hard as anyone. I'm penalized for being single and not putting a kid or elderly parent on my lease. Wanna give me a job at 68 years old? Show me the apartments of those on the waiting list of the "over housed" money the government will be saving.
@ Earl Horton, I promise not to judge peoples' reasons for staying in any particular place or leaving if they promise not to make me pay for it.
Ssshh!  What, are you TRYING to get sued?!

A better movie might be filming multiple groups having their campaigns over the course of a year or two, and splicing the good parts together.

This game was a lot of fun.
Time to pull out the dice....highest roll wins the rights to the film!

and actually - IF Scotland doesn't want to maintain a political union anymore - BUT still some kind of monetary union with the UK - than Scotland has to make do.-(as everybody who wants to join the Euro has to make do)

And economists - who believe that the world rotates around monetary policies always will ponder the 'monetary' disadvantages and advantages - and everybody else with other priorities will have other priorities - like: Is there some sense in wearing a Kilt with underwear?

The first plantatation of Ulster was created in 1608, when James VI/I was monarch in the immediate aftermath of the Flight of the Earls  when Hugh O'Neill and Hugh O'Donnell left for Spain in November 1607.  Sir Thomas Smith and Walter Devereux, the first earl of Essex drew the first plan for the Ulster plantation in 1571, but little came of the adventure after Sir Thomas's son, also named Thomas was murdered by tow of their Irish servants, and Essex subsequent involvement in the massacre at Rathlin Island.  The first actual plans for a plantation system in Ireland was proposed  by Thomas Cromwell, Henry VIII's chief administrator and Walter Cowley in 1536 in the aftermath of the failed Kildare Rebellion which had ended the previously year.  However, the plantation of Laois and Offaly was not officially launched until the reign of the Catholic monarch Mary I in 1556.  The largest and most successful plantation of the 16th century was to be the Munster plantation which began in 1569-70, but was destroyed in 1598 during the Nine Years'War.

Do not speak ill of the dead, we are told, as they cannot defend themselves now.

There are some dead who even if they could speak, would have no legitimate defense against the ill that can be spoken of what they had done.

Sir Edward Carsons actions  at that time prevented a major civil war. I believe no one at that time wanted a divided Ireland as they could foresee problems lay ahead. In fact Dominion status was offered along the same lines as Canada however was rejected there are no black and whites only grey.

80% of Ulster did NOT want to remain with Britain, since Ulster was split apart to ensure a Protestant majority. As for majorities, the whole of Ireland would constitute a majority which would not (and did not) vote for partition. Your comment is disingenuous at best.

Growing up in County Mayo, my wife said Paisley seemed like the devil incarnate. Funny that all his hate-filled fulminations, a reaction formation to his religious self-depredations, came back to roost at his own door.

Pretty sad thinking Mark.
I know my congressman, he is a doctor and is concerned about the affordability of eduction. His wife is also a doctor with Kaiser in Sacramento. He is well respected by his colleagues at U.C. Davis where he was on the admissions committee. He has no reason to lie to us, he tries to do what we elected him for. He is an honest and decent man.

Now I can not say the same for his current opponent. He is worth about $100million and is being financed by the Rove gang and the Chamber of Commerce. They accuse him of being part of the problem in Washington. He is in his first term and a democrat, so how can he be part of the problem when he does not have any say, other than to vote with his party? They accuse him of voting against several measures like jobs, and the economy, but all those charges are due to him supporting the ACA, which is one reason we worked to help him beat a conservative who had actually been a Nixon favorite.

However this district is a close one, and about half the voters here believe these charges, true or not. When well financed groups can make specious charges, buy over $1million in TV time and my reps finances are primarily from his supporters, we can only hope people see through the lies and obfuscations.

So yes if you believe these campaigns of lies and propaganda, you deserve the reps you get. But in the long run, it is the voters who are responsible for supporting these prevaricators.

The owners of America want to outsource.  They don't need U.S. employees when foreigner will work remotely and cheaper.  They don't need to grow domestic brainpower because you can still buy it cheaper abroad.  They want obedient slaves (even if not legally so) who'll perpetuate the status quo and, uncomplaining, take what they're given.  Politicians are the easiest to buy because all they do is sell and everything is for sale.  Feed their egos by allowing the pretense of power.  David Halberstam wrote that his own class did not understand why Averill Harriman wanted to be President because they knew the power came from the President's having to come to them.  Halberstam also related how JFK offered Defense or State to Bob Lovitt who didn't vote for him and, upon Lovitt's refusal, hired his suggestions: Rusk and McNamara.  The voters have been irrelevant since, perhaps, Eisenhower.
